The light should fall obliquely upon the pre-
paration & a black background should be 
placed at a distance of from two to three 
feet from it. The darker the surroundings 
of the preparation & the observer & the brighter the light brought 
to bear upon the former the better will the 
course of fibres be seen. Some little art & 
practice is required before the preparation can 
be seen at its best. <s>and it need hardly be 
said that a little practice just as in the 
use of the microscope or laryngoscope or other 
instrument of precision is <s>requisite <s> an additional 
advantage in rendering the appearance intellig-
ible.<\s>
[It is <s>further <\s> of no use beginning to examine 
details such as are brought out <s>manifested<\s> by this method 
<s>of inquiry <\s> without having a perfect idea of 
the general position shape & so forth of the grosser
parts of the brain. Thus the position of the 
basal ganglia, the Island of Reil, Claustrum &
<s>outer <\s> the capsules must be thoroughly fixed in the 
mind of the observer <s>before <\s> in order to obtain 
any clear understanding of their minuter structure 
& connections of these or neighbouring parts. It 
requires very considerable study to comprehend 
in some cases what one is looking at as the 
parts <s>look<\s> appear so different when cut in various directions.
